snippet: The Susan G. Komen for the Cure foundation was faced with dissension in its own ranks and roiling anger online over its decision to end its long partnership with Planned Parenthood.
abstract: Susan G Komen for the Cure foundation is facing dissension in its own ranks and roiling anger online over its decision to end its long partnership with Planned Parenthood; Komen’s founder and chief executive, Nancy G Brinker, insists that the organization’s decision had nothing to do with abortion or politics, saying instead that it resulted from improved grant-making procedures, and is not intended to make a target of Planned Parenthood.

byline.original: By JENNIFER PRESTON and GARDINER HARRIS

lead_paragraph: The Susan G. Komen for the Cure foundation was faced with dissension in its own ranks and roiling anger online over its decision to end its long partnership with Planned Parenthood.

headline.seo: Komen Foundation Urged to Restore Planned Parenthood Funds
headline.main: Outcry Is Fierce to Cut in Funds by Cancer Group
headline.print_headline: Outcry Is Fierce To Cut In Funds By Cancer Group

keywords.value: Komen, Susan G, for the Cure
keywords.name: organizations
